meanings.definition: Substances that stimulate the production of agglutinins in the blood.
meanings.sent1: The agglutinogens triggered the body to make agglutinins to fight infections.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study agglutinogens to understand how the body responds to foreign substances.
meanings.sent3: The agglutinogens in the blood were like little messengers telling the immune system to wake up.
meanings.sent4: The agglutinogens acted as alarm bells, alerting the body to potential threats.
meanings.sent5: Imagine the agglutinogens as tiny keys that unlock the body's defense mechanisms.

meanings.definition: Antigens that cause agglutination of red blood cells.
meanings.sent1: Doctors use agglutinogens to identify blood types in patients.
meanings.sent2: The agglutinogens in the blood samples reacted with specific antibodies.
meanings.sent3: The agglutinogens played a game of 'red blood cell dominoes' in the lab.
meanings.sent4: The agglutinogens were like magnets pulling the red blood cells together.
meanings.sent5: Visualize the agglutinogens as tiny bridges linking the red blood cells.
